    level="1"
    right="Item 10"
    pfs=""
>
[Ghastly Cauldron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1707)
</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Invested" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=98" />
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Negative" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=118" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 75

**Price** 900 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 5
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

This black cooking pot can produce a feast fit for [undead](/Traits.aspx?ID=160).

**Activate** <actions string="Three Actions" /> Interact;   **Trigger** once per day; **Requirements** The cauldron must be filled with water, herbs, bones, and raw meat, and kept at a boil for 1 hour; **Effect** As you stir the cauldron, its contents transform into 10 meals suitable for undead consumption. Each meal must be ladled from the cauldron individually as a 3-action activity and must be eaten within 1 hour of removal. An undead creature that consumes a meal from the cauldron regains 5d8 Hit Points and gains the benefits of 4th-level [_restoration_](/Spells.aspx?ID=258) that you choose; living creatures who consume a meal from the cauldron take 5d8 negative damage (DC 27 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save) instead. Any meals remaining in the cauldron 24 hours after activation become inedible slurry.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
